1. Go to GitHub.
1. Click on your profile picture in the upper-right corner and select "Settings".
1. In the left sidebar, click "Developer settings".
1. In the left sidebar, click "Personal access tokens".
1. Click "Generate new token".
1. Give your token a descriptive name.
1. Select the scopes or permissions you'd like to grant this token.
For uploading a repository, select the `repo scope`.
1 .Click Generate token.
1. Copy the token and store it in a secure place.
You won't be able to see it again.
1. Use the PAT for GitHub authentication.
When prompted for a username and password for GitHub operations (like `git push`), use your GitHub username as the username and the generated PAT as the password.
